findings.title: Denial-of-service conditions caused by the use of more than 256 slices
findings.description: The owner of a Proteus-based automated market maker (AMM) can update the system parameters to cause a denial of service (DoS) upon the execution of swaps, withdrawals, and deposits.

findings.title: LiquidityPoolProxy owners can steal user funds
findings.description: The owner of a LiquidityPoolProxy contract can replace the underlying implementation with a malicious contract to steal user funds via a call to setImplementation.

findings.title: Risk of sandwich attacks
findings.description: The LiquidityPool contract is vulnerable to sandwich attacks, which means a user could lose all funds provided for a swap.

findings.title: Project dependencies contain vulnerabilities
findings.description: The project's dependencies underscore, async, lodash, and node-fetch contain arbitrary code injection, prototype pollution, command injection, and exposure of sensitive information to an unauthorized actor vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Use of duplicate functions
findings.description: The `ProteusLogic` and `Proteus` contracts both contain a function used to update the internal `slices` array, which could lead to divergence between the contracts.

findings.title: Loss of Pool Tokens due to Identity Curve Configurations
findings.description: Certain identity curve configurations can lead to a loss of pool tokens or dilution of liquidity provider tokens due to rounding errors in integer division operations.

findings.title: Lack of events for critical operations
findings.description: The contract does not emit events for critical operations, making it difficult to track and monitor important actions.

findings.title: Ocean may accept unexpected airdrops
findings.description: The Ocean contract enables _ERC721InteractionStatus and _ERC1155InteractionStatus flags in unwrapping operations, allowing for airdrops as the recipient of tokens is the Ocean contract, not the user.

findings.title: Rounding Error in Integer Division Operation
findings.description: A rounding error in an integer division operation could lead to a loss of pool tokens and the dilution of liquidity provider (LP) tokens.
